problem_summary_simple: Rearrange an array to maximize the count of positive prefix sums.
problem_summary_technical: Sorts the array in descending order and greedily adds elements to maximize positive prefix sums.
key_insights: To maximize the number of positive prefix sums, we should place the largest positive numbers at the beginning of the array.
Sorting the array in descending order ensures that we are always adding the largest available number to the current sum.
If at any point the current sum becomes non-positive, adding any subsequent smaller (or negative) numbers will not make it positive again, so we stop.
